summary: This is an internal email chain from June 22, 2020, discussing the imminent arrest and charging of Ghislaine Maxwell. It details the planned charges, her suspected location in Massachusetts, and operational plans for surveillance and arrest.

persons.name: Watson
persons.context: FBI SSA from New York providing updates on the charging and arrest plans for Ghislaine Maxwell, including details on charges, location, and surveillance.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'her' and 'Maxwell'; the email chain details the plan to charge and arrest her on multiple federal counts including conspiracy, enticement, transportation, and perjury.

persons.name: Jeffery Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a forwarded question from a Deputy Director (DD) asking for an update on the status of the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: The document is part of the investigation into Maxwell following Epstein's death, indicating their alleged conspiratorial relationship is the subject of the charges.
SSA Watson is the lead FBI agent providing the operational update on charging and arresting Maxwell.

events.title: Planning for Maxwell's Arrest
events.description: Internal FBI/DOJ email chain discusses moving up the arrest timeline for Ghislaine Maxwell from August to within the next few weeks, following a conference call with SDNY.

events.title: Finalization of Charges Against Maxwell
events.description: Email lists the specific federal charges likely to be brought against Ghislaine Maxwell via indictment, including conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury.

events.title: Location and Surveillance Planning
events.description: Law enforcement believes Maxwell is in Massachusetts, quarantining at a boyfriend's house, and plans to activate GPS on two possible mobile phones upon obtaining an arrest warrant.

keyFacts: On June 22, 2020, the FBI was actively planning to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell and charge her via indictment with six federal counts including conspiracy to entice and transport minors, enticement, transportation, and perjury.
Law enforcement believed Maxwell was located in Massachusetts, specifically quarantining at a boyfriend's house, and had identified two possible mobile phones for GPS tracking upon warrant issuance.
The arrest timeline was being moved up from an initial August target to potentially within a few weeks, pending a conference call with the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
